body_html:
The official benchmarks have not been affected as you can see here

So the question is what you are doing different from official pipelines.

One possibility is if you are using feed_dict, which is not well tested by those benchmarks. Upgrading past TensorFlow 1.6 changes alignment requirement which will lead to slowdown if you use feed_dict, see #17233
body_text:
The official benchmarks have not been affected as you can see here
So the question is what you are doing different from official pipelines.
One possibility is if you are using feed_dict, which is not well tested by those benchmarks. Upgrading past TensorFlow 1.6 changes alignment requirement which will lead to slowdown if you use feed_dict, see #17233
body:
The official benchmarks have not been affected as you can see [here](https://benchmarks-dot-tensorflow-testing.appspot.com/)

So the question is what you are doing different from official pipelines.

One possibility is if you are using feed_dict, which is not well tested by those benchmarks. Upgrading past TensorFlow 1.6 changes alignment requirement which will lead to slowdown if you use feed_dict, see https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/17233
